text: Designed in the 1940s but produced in the late 1950s and 1960s by the L.M. Ericsson Company, the Ericofon represents the incorporation of new materials into Scandinavian design of the post-war period. Designers Blomberg, Lysell, and Thames used lightweight plastic to create a practical, one-piece phone with the dial on the bottom, retaining the functionalism of previous decades while experimenting with a sculptural, curved form often described as a cobra.
title: "Ericofon" rotary-dial telephones
